str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A gate. Apparently a primary word; a gate, i.e. The leaf or wing of a folding entrance.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A river, torrent, stream. Probably from a derivative of the alternate of pino; a current, brook or freshet, i.e. Running water.
Where, whither, when, in what place. Genitive case of hos as adverb; at which place, i.e. Where.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Feminine Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.
